Despite the COVID pandemic's impacts on the 2020 Census, the statutory deadline for 2020 Census data collection was not extended by the current administration.

September 30th is still the deadline for 2020 Census data collection.

Vermont is among states with the lowest response rates in the country. We need everyone living in Vermont to be counted to ensure our taxpayer dollars come back to the state, and to ensure our legislative districts are accurate.

Thirty percent (30%) of VT households have yet to respond or be counted by an enumerator.

This is a BIG LIFT for us over the final six weeks.

From our superintendent:
OSSU community members:

On this final student day of the 19-20 school year, I want to thank each of you--student, parent, staff member, administrator, community member--for working together to make the best of an unusual, and often difficult, situation! Remote learning has been a learning experience for all of us, and in that respect we are better for it.
Congratulations to all the graduates moving on from both high school and elementary school—I wish you success in your future endeavors!
I wish everyone a well deserved summer—please continue to practice social distancing, hand washing, etc. so the curve continues to flatten and we may start and stay in school next fall.
Be well-
Adam

Hardwick Neighbor to Neighbor

Press Release

Face Mask Initiative

The Hardwick Area Neighbor to Neighbor group has set a goal to provide a face mask, free of charge, for every person in this area still without one. Currently 25 volunteer sewers are generously donating their time and materials to make this possible. This is one simple way that we can all care for one another.

If you or someone you know does not currently have a mask, go to the Hardwick Village Restaurant take-out window any time between 6AM and 8PM to pick one up. Or, head to the Hardwick Area Food Pantry Monday 12-2PM or Thursday and Saturday from 9-11:00AM. You do not need to be a customer at either establishment to pick up a mask. If you are in the East Hardwick area, contact Lisa at or call 472-6207 and she will arrange a pick-up with you at her house. Or, call or text 802-441-3301 or email to request a mask be delivered to you or someone you know.

Please, only one mask per person so that we can be sure that every individual who needs a mask has one.

Volunteering is Making a Difference!
Have you ever thought about volunteering at
Hardwick Elementary?

Hardwick Elementary School is in need of volunteers for a variety of activities throughout the school year.

If you would like to volunteer, simply stop by the office and pick up a volunteer form and a background check form. (If you’ve filled out the forms for the background check, you do not need to fill out another. The background check is good for three years). You do not need to be fingerprinted.

We hope you find volunteering at HES a rewarding experience. Your energy, generosity, caring, and dependability are all part of the positive role model you provide for our students. The staff and students appreciate and value the gift of your time, be it one hour or 200 hours.

Bottle Drive on Behalf of Bridget Mallo. As many of you know Bridget Mallo, 15, recently lost her battle with Cystic Fibrosis. Her only dying wish was to raise awareness of this awful disease, and we can all help with that by donating our bottles and cans. We are doing a bottle drive for Cystic Fibrosis research, being held at M&M Beverage on June 21, 2019. Donations prior to this day can be dropped off at Gary and Paula Mallo's house at 86 Cherry Street Hardwick, VT. Here you can also see a garden the family has planted in honor of Bridget. Any monetary donations for this foundation would also be greatly appreciated. Let's help Bridget's dreams of having CF standing for Cure Found.

Thank You
Mike Baker
